bow: why did have 2nd kid always always thought that if was going to have kids have grew up an only child and always wanted sibling my husband has one sister and they are really close had my daughter who is the most wonderful beautiful sweet little girl she has always been an easy baby we decided to have second one quickly so they were close in age she know and our new baby boy is months old whyyyy did do this it would have been so much easier with just her can do anything with this baby things are so hard right now this baby doesn let me do anything he been colicky he loud he wants and needs constant attention sometimes wonder why the hell did do this to myself and there absolutely no way of changing this stuck with him why does he have to be so needy why can he just play in his playground chair bouncy swing etc why does he cry all the time why did do this the first one is always good to trick you into this exact situation lol mine aren quite that close in age but my youngest are are born end of april born beginning of april and 11 months born end of march so almost exactly years between each it is hard the first months were horrible and really it wasn until close to year that things settled bit my last three have all been very attached to me poor sleepers poor eaters so more nursing didn even like daddy so always in my arms once they start being able to sit things started to get bit better might get 10 15 minutes here and there with them down once they started crawling it got even little easier since they re happy to explore more my 11 month old is still very needy but she likes to crawl after her brothers and can get an hour some days with her just happily exploring and playing but she still will only sleep on me now the fighting between the two boys amp is the hardest part of my day most days lol it does get better it does get easier take the breaks you need and remember that if you ve tried everything it okay to leave the baby to cry in safe spot for moment if you need to for your sanity it will get better hang in there mine are and now and love having two they do fight of course but they are also sweet and loving with each other and have great fun playing together when my youngest was baby and was up with him in the middle of the night and then my daughter would get up too and they both be crying would tell myself when they are and or and it will be so much easier and then one day they were and and remembered that and thought hey was right the first year is definitely the hardest having colicky baby is an extreme test in resilience and mental strength our first was colicky and it was such tough time that we heavily debated being one and done so understand where you re at right now know it little consolation when you re in the middle of it but honestly having colicky baby is something you just need to survive it will get better but it going to be rough ride we had to make lot of adjustments in the first year we did go out get together with friends or plan to do anything after work my husband cooked very simple meals and served them to me in cut up bites so could hold our crying baby and eat at the same time we functioned on less then hours of sleep for months it was not happy time and it was hard to watch my friends *enjoying* their new babies while was simply trying to survive mine you are not alone in this experience but unfortunately it hard for those who have experienced it to understand do be afraid to ask for help find schedule that maximizes any sleep opportunities you can take simplify your life in any ways you can when he cries put in earphones and play music if you need to you can soothe him without hearing the cries and if it helps calm you it will be better for both of you and just know that this *is* temporary and at some point which is hard to believe right now you will be looking back on this time trying for my second our first is beautiful month old baby girl who is easy and funny and smart and is sleeping in her own room now you got me little scared things are so good now and getting more fun and calmer all the time maybe should leave well enough alone really want second but am scared that it will be like you are describing all can think is that it will get better when they are older and can entertain each other in the meantime hope you can ask for help and remember that the house can be dirty and if you don get dressed for week who cares it survival mode for while if it any consolation my good friend has the same family we do she has two year old girl and month old boy she is doing great and her second baby is just as easy sweet and giggly as her first was just lost the happy baby lottery yep colic is major reason we only have one kid even now it amazes me when see babies and toddlers that just sort of chill love her to pieces but even now my kid has no chill you didn want another baby you wanted another child babies are the price you pay it ll get better and you ll be so glad you made this sacrifice are you me but seriously this is the exact situation was in few months ago lived my life on the floor with the baby right next to me just so would have to hold her while my year old pretty much ran the house could put the baby down to go to the bathroom without her screaming bloody murder let alone clean or cook or anything thankfully my husband was working swing at the time so that at least gave me mornings to shower and take care of the house little this went on for months freaking months then something happened like switch just flipped in her brain put her down to get something from the kitchen and she was *fine with it* she happily sat and played with toy in the living room while waving to me now she completely different baby few things that helped me so much were babywearing and getting high chair like this one https www amazon com summer infant portable booster green dp b01azc36z8 ref=mp 17 keywords=baby+seat amp qid=1551805375 amp s=gateway amp sr=8 17 to put on the kitchen counter while made dinner washed dishes of course make sure the baby is far away from anything hot or dangerous if you do that and make sure you re standing right there so they do tumble off the counter you ll get through this promise does he have any allergies yes it is hard and stressful my eldest was 17 months when we had our second and third as it turned out to be twins we are finally starting to get our heads above water now that the kids are and but it been rough until very recently but now am really grateful for our little pack with three girls close in age they are constantly goofing around playing together looking out for each other consoling each other and having blast as siblings there is still fighting and arguing and wanting alone time with us parents but all having more than one is blessing both for them and us as it takes the pressure off us when they play nice together until you get there though make sure you look after yourself set aside time for alone time and do something you enjoy for yourself and be alert to signs of depression as it is easy to burn out if your mental health starts declining seek help the sooner the better as taking care of yourself is vital to being able to care for your children tldr yes it is hard but it will get better until then make sure to care for your own well being as well hang in there my first was super easy perfect baby absolute breeze my second was colicky cranky crabby needy eventually at around months we had to resort to ranitidine zantac and probiotic because she was having lot of digestive discomfort that helped we stopped that at about 10 months she much more fun and independent now but she still more needy than my older one was she 15 months now she is teething and cranky right now but still so much better than those early months hang in there momma remember the days are long but the years are short re colic it sounds like you re also exhausted op there another thread or sub around here somewhere that recently mentioned food allergies or intolerances as source of colic maybe consider this with your little guy maybe try eliminating one thing at time and see if things resolve or do an elimination diet eliminate all common allergens and then add one back at time to see if there change the most common triggers are milk dairy soy wheat peanuts eggs and tree nuts ll try and find the sub and post link here know it no consolation but want you to know it okay to give up on trying to comfort him and let him cry once you ve determined he not hungry and his diaper is dry you can lay him in his crib and go take shower you can set him in his bouncer and play game with your toddler you can put him in his saucer and make dinner yes it will be loud but it loud when he cries in your face too right if there nothing you can do to comfort him and let face it often there will be nothing you can do let him cry and take care of yourself instead my baby is quite as cranky as you described and there were still many times that she would cry and not want to eat and not need diaper change and no go to sleep so would put her down and take shower letting her cry for 10 minutes while took break was the best thing could do for her once had clean hair and fresh clothes on could feel sorry for her again and go pick her up without resenting her for being so difficult other moms are feeling the same way you feel and many of us have easier babies you are not alone in this does he have allergies do you have post partum depression colic can be sign for allergies months pregnant with baby now and have to admit my fear of the newborn phase is constantly in the back of my mind feel like ticking time bomb we decided we felt very strongly about our child having sibling and made up our minds that we would pursue it even if it ends up being high price to pay temporarily basically hoping for the best but preparing for the worst figure if can survive it once can survive it twice did you see this thread https www reddit com parenting comments axdt7q please consider the idea that your child has about colicky babies and allergies in parenting thank you that all my husband and can do is keep telling each other it ll get better so sorry that you re going through this and omg this scares me have year old boy and my second arrives in august my first was colicky for about months but he generally happy and independent baby and now toddler he didn need to always be held is very active but not destructive at all takes care of his stuff and is insanely organized right since he was little he also the opposite of picky eater and loves to eat anything and everything that we give him am 100 sure my next will be the opposite of him and we will have no idea why we got ourselves into this however all can say to you is that it will get better as your daughter gets older she ll start engaging more with the baby and the baby will also start connecting with his sister also as she gets potty trained it ll be one less set of diaper changes and all that hang in there mama ❤️ thanks know we ll get through this and we ll be better for it just want this baby phase to be over ca wait until he walking my first was so independent and this one is soo not that way this too shall pass soon you ll be looking at pictures on your phone of this potato phase thinking that they re so cute and you wish you could go back at least for second before you come to your senses lol heard comedian once say know why we had second one but why the hell did we have three https www youtube com watch v=gvao4c3g vy https www youtube com watch v=gvao4c3g vy amp x200b pretty much describes our situation there will not be third thanks for your kind words waiting for it to get better thank you it sucks going to sleep at with the kids and missing out on any adult time my husband and could have but being sleep deprived is worse agree people often say colic but lot of times the baby has dairy sensitivity my 2nd had what the doctors and my parents called colic and went dairy free while breastfeeding and my daughter improved 75 try and change baby formula or breastmilk and see if it helps not sure but not breastfeeding quit breastfeeding last month he drinks similac lactose free formula thanks do think need more rest that for sure do breastfeed anymore quit about month ago and he eats similac lactose free sensitive formula my 1st child was colicky clingy non sleeping mess she was such hell that my husband has erased the thought of 2nd child from his mind permanently because all he can think about is what if it another lo hang in there having sibling is worth it the closer they get to walking the easier it gets thank you he is getting better he used to cry all the time and never smile for the first months of his life the last two months we are getting smiles and he likes to play more he still so needy though he wants us to hold him and prop him up all the time in our laps have floor seats bumbo and fisher price bouncer play mats swings etc and he just does seem to be ok with any of those for more than minutes stop breathe now breathe again it will pass as with your first child it gets better have three youngest now months and feel what you feel daily hang in there love put the baby down and take walk treat yourself with chocolate coffee milkshake etc take moment for you and know that you can make it through this we are all rooting you on thank you so much for this do know but do breastfeed he eats similac lactose sensitivity formula do think have post partum depression but do think have post partum rage and am seeing therapist every other week just started and have only had two sessions and that is why ca have third my husband and are both terrified that even if we wanted another child we end up with twins really look forward to them being little older and playing together lt that why had two so they have each other always thank you could have written this post my kids are 2y3mo apart and my 2nd was clinger and needy and my oldest is unicorn kid even now will say hindsight being 20 20 had some mild ppd so consider that possibility it does get easier and sometimes harder my 2nd still is my challenge kid at almost but you ll get through this and you ll love the bond these kiddos have hugs mama it is difficult at your next pediatric visit would ask about allergies because more literature is coming out that colic is an indicator of allergies why would you choose lactose sensitive formula we had only just been discussing another baby had 6yo ss and 7m son when we discovered that not only was pregnant pill failed but that it was twins they are all now 10 almost and 5yo twins that first year was hell my husband always said my ss was easy our son was over all really easy going the twins took turns of one being easy the other being hell then would switch it up just to keep us on our toes now that they are older they can communicate and entertain each other and sleep at night it so much easier there are still tantrums and meltdowns bc this one took that ones toys etc but being able to say to them go play with your brother sister while sit for minutes is awesome even better are the times they try and take care of each other when one falls they are right there helping to pick them up and give hugs and kisses they make each other laugh those big belly laughs while playing in bed at night did see this and guess he could be allergic to soy ll look into this more and see what other options have for formula thank you understand completely have to say though feel so grateful and blessed to be mother of twins to be able to witness the special bond they have up close is truly special and the dynamic between the two of them is very different from the dynamic they have with their big sister even though it been hard would have wanted it any other way it has definitely been worth the struggle he could have an allergy to his current formula or simply not like it explore the option of allergy testing chose lactose sensitive formula because of the things mentioned here colic being sign of allergies also tried the dairy protein free formula but it smelled so bad could feed it to him also tried probiotic drops and that did seem to help my pediatrician just told me he colicky you re just going to have to live with that going to see different pediatrician at his month check up because did really like that he seemed to get little better with the say from months he scream cried all the time and never once saw smile now at months see smiles and giggles all the time he just still so needy and wants to be held all the time as soon as put him in
